box_shadow_color="rgba(0,0,0,0.08)" global_colors_info="{}" theme_builder_area="post_content"]<h2>About Women's Ministry</h2>
<p>The spiritual vision of [Adventist] Women’s Ministries is to know Jesus passionately and to serve and disciple other women. We are committed to encouraging, challenging, equipping and nurturing Seventh-day Adventist women as they do their part in carrying the Gospel message to the world.[1]</p>
<p>In the Australian Union Conference, we believe that every woman has a God-given potential and we want to empower them, encourage them and equip them to confidently share their faith in whichever context they find themselves in.</p>
<p>Our mission is in the larger sense common to all Christians—that of uplifting Christ in the Church and in the world. But more specifically, we are called to:</p>
<ul>
<li><strong>Nurture</strong>—Reach Up to God</li>
<li><strong>Empower</strong>—Reach Across with God</li>
<li><strong>Outreach</strong>—Reach Out with God[2]</li>
</ul>
<p>Adventist Women’s Ministries around the world promotes three special days:<br />International Women’s Day of Prayer is the first Sabbath of each March when women have the opportunity to strengthen their spiritual bonds as they pray for and with each other.<br />Women’s Ministries Emphasis Day falls on the second Sabbath of each June. This provides an opportunity for women to lead out in a worship service and to educate the church regarding the purposes of Women's Ministries.<br />enditnow® Emphasis Day is observed on the fourth Sabbath in August. This worldwide church initiative is included in the Church's Calendar of Days and Events.<br />The General Conference of the Seventh-day Adventist church provides resources that can be used by local churches around the world on these three special days.</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<ol>
<li><em>Spiritual Vision (SPD) <a href="https://women.adventistchurch.com/">https://women.adventistchurch.com/</a></em></li>
<li><em>General Conference Mission <a href="https://women.adventist.org/wm-mission-statement">https://women.adventist.org/wm-mission-statement</a></em></li>

Bible says about...</h1>[/et_pb_text][et_pb_text _builder_version="4.18.0" _module_preset="default" header_font="||||||||" header_2_font="|||on|||||" header_2_text_color="#ff8200" header_2_font_size="14px" header_2_letter_spacing="1px" global_colors_info="{}" theme_builder_area="post_content"]<h2><span data-metadata="&lt;!--(figmeta)eyJmaWxlS2V5Ijoid3BobTNFVTdnbDFvd2lkWkVXbEhsTyIsInBhc3RlSUQiOjE2NTA1Njc4MTMsImRhdGFUeXBlIjoic2NlbmUifQo=(/figmeta)--&gt;"></span><span data-buffer="&lt;!--(figma)(/figma)--&gt;"></span><span>What we believe about God shapes how we see everything else.</span></h2>[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built="1" _builder_version="4.18.0" _module_preset="default" background_color="#eeeeee" custom_padding="0px||18px|||" global_colors_info="{}" theme_builder_area="post_content"][et_pb_row !important;||" border_radii="on|3px|3px|3px|3px" border_width_top="1px" border_color_top="#ff8200" box_shadow_style="preset3" box_shadow_color="rgba(0,0,0,0.05)" global_colors_info="{}" theme_builder_area="post_content"]<p>Our Creator God is love, power and splendor. He is three-in-one, mysterious and infinite—yet He desires an intimate connection with humanity. He gave us the Bible as His Holy Word, the Bible, so we could learn more about Him and build a relationship with Him.</p>[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row column_structure="3_4,1_4" use_custom_gutter="on" gutter_width="2" _builder_version="4.18.0" _module_preset="default" global_colors_info="{}" theme_builder_area="post_content"][et_pb_column type="3_4" _builder_version="4.18.0" _module_preset="default" global_colors_info="{}" theme_builder_area="post_content"][et_pb_video src="https://youtu.be/UFjt_sBii3w" _builder_version="4.18.0" _module_preset="default" global_colors_info="{}" theme_builder_area="post_content"][/et_pb_video][et_pb_text _builder_version="4.18.0" _module_preset="default" text_font="Montserrat|300|||||||" text_font_size="16px" text_line_height="1.6em" header_2_font="Montserrat|500|||||||" header_2_text_color="#7a7a7a" header_2_font_size="36px" background_color="#ffffff" custom_padding="50px|50px|50px|50px|true|true" border_width_top="1px" border_color_top="#ff8200" box_shadow_style="preset3" box_shadow_color="rgba(0,0,0,0.08)" global_colors_info="{}" theme_builder_area="post_content"]<h2>1. Holy Scriptures</h2>
<p>The Holy Scriptures, Old and New Testaments, are the written Word of God, given by divine inspiration.</p>
<p>The inspired authors spoke and wrote as they were moved by the Holy Spirit. In this Word, God has committed to humanity the knowledge necessary for salvation.</p>
<p>The Holy Scriptures are the supreme, authoritative, and the infallible revelation of His will. They are the standard of character, the test of experience, the definitive revealer of doctrines, and the trustworthy record of God’s acts in history.</p>
<p>(Ps. 119:105; Prov. 30:5, 6; Isa. 8:20; John 17:17; 1 Thess. 2:13; 2 Tim. 3:16, 17; Heb. 4:12; 2 Peter 1:20, 21.)</p>[/et_pb_text][et_pb_text _builder_version="4.18.0" _module_preset="default" text_font="Montserrat|300|||||||" text_font_size="16px" text_line_height="1.6em" header_2_font="Montserrat|500||on|||||" header_2_text_color="#7a7a7a" header_2_font_size="36px" header_3_font="|300||on|||||" header_3_font_size="25px" header_3_line_height="1.5em" background_color="#ffffff" custom_padding="50px|50px|50px|50px|true|true" border_width_top="1px" border_color_top="#ff8200" box_shadow_style="preset3" box_shadow_color="rgba(0,0,0,0.08)" global_colors_info="{}" theme_builder_area="post_content"]<h2>What is the Bible?</h2>
God’s holy Scriptures, the Bible, is unique among all of the books, a compilation of many manuscripts, hand written sacred texts. Originally written in Hebrew, Aramaic, and Koine Greek, these ancient manuscripts were then copied by hand time and time again and were distributed throughout different parts of the world.

After more than a thousand years, these manuscripts were gathered together, compared and compiled as they were verified one with another. No other ancient historical writings had been copied and distributed nearly as much as these sacred texts.
<h3>Origins of the Bible</h3>
</span><span>It was written by more than 40 authors living on three different continents over a span of 1,500 years—yet its words were inspired by God. He inspired human authors and through them, He communicated His will to the rest of humanity (2 Peter 1:20-21).
</span>

<span>That’s why the Bible does so well at reaching people at differing points in their lives, amid different situations, and with a wide spectrum of perspective. The Bible reveals God, but through human eyes so we can relate.
</span>

<span>These days, people question everything. They question the news, authority figures, and even themselves. It’s almost a default mindset when there’s so much contradictory information confronting us each day from a variety of media.</span>
<h3><span>When was the Bible written?</span></h3>
<span>It can sometimes feel like there’s no real right answer to anything. But even amid all the confusion and noise of the world, the Bible can be the one source of information that is completely trustworthy. It teaches us the right way to live, reveals God’s character, and holds the answer to all our big questions.
<em><strong></strong></em></span>

<span><em><strong>2 Timothy 3:16</strong> even describes Scripture as “breathed out by God,” and “profitable for teaching, for reproof, for correction, for training in righteousness” (ESV).</em></span>[/et_pb_text][et_pb_image src="https://adventist.org.au/wp-content/uploads/2022/10/travel-2650303_1920-1-1.jpg" title_text="travel-2650303_1920 1" _builder_version="4.18.0" _module_preset="default" global_colors_info="{}" theme_builder_area="post_content"][/et_pb_image][et_pb_text _builder_version="4.18.0" _module_preset="default" text_font="Montserrat|300|||||||" text_font_size="16px" text_line_height="1.6em" header_2_font="Montserrat|500||on|||||" header_2_text_color="#7a7a7a" header_2_font_size="36px" header_3_font="|300||on|||||" header_3_font_size="25px" header_3_line_height="1.5em" background_color="#ffffff" custom_padding="50px|50px|50px|50px|true|true" border_width_top="1px" border_color_top="#ff8200" box_shadow_style="preset3" box_shadow_color="rgba(0,0,0,0.08)" global_colors_info="{}" theme_builder_area="post_content"]<h2>History of the Bible?</h2>
The psalmist once wrote: “Your word is a lamp for my feet, a light on my path” (Psalm 119:105, CSB).

How true that is. Scripture holds instructions, wisdom, and guidance for every decision we might face, serving as a roadmap for life. The Bible’s pages are full of wisdom, telling us what God asks of us and how He wants us to live.<img src="https://adventist.org.au/wp-content/uploads/2022/10/bible-gbf265093a_1280-1-235x300.jpg" width="235" height="300" alt="" class="wp-image-8797 alignnone size-medium" style="float: right;" />

But the Bible isn’t just a collection of words and sayings, it’s a story. The story of the human race. It tells us how God created humanity to be perfect, how humanity lost that perfection, and how God has been fighting to restore us ever since.

The Bible is the story of humanity’s flaws and failures overcome by God’s love and forgiveness. Humans fall short at making things right, but God will always come through.

This is another way the Bible serves as a roadmap. It reveals our own tendencies, the flaws that came along with our fallen nature. It tells us the stories of people who struggled to live in a world full of both good and evil, the choices they made, and how God worked in their lives. It gives us examples of both what to do and what not to do, instructing us on the reasoning behind the doctrines we practice and the choices God wants us to make.
<h3>Bible canon</h3>
Although the Scriptures were meant to instruct us, there are parts of it that can be confusing. Even scholars struggle with the exact meaning of some passages. There are times when it seems simpler to just take the preacher’s word for it instead of trying to sort things out for ourselves.
</span>

&nbsp;[/et_pb_text][et_pb_text _builder_version="4.18.0" _module_preset="default" text_font="Montserrat|300|||||||" text_font_size="23px" text_line_height="1.3em" header_2_font="Montserrat|500||on|||||" header_2_text_color="#7a7a7a" header_2_font_size="36px" header_3_font="|300||on|||||" header_3_font_size="25px" header_3_line_height="1.5em" header_6_text_color="#ff8200" header_6_line_height="3em" background_color="#ffffff" background_image="https://adventist.org.au/wp-content/uploads/2022/09/iconmonstr-quote-5-1.png" background_size="initial" background_position="top_right" text_orientation="center" custom_padding="58px|30px|35px|30px|false|true" border_width_top="1px" border_color_top="#ff8200" box_shadow_style="preset3" box_shadow_color="rgba(0,0,0,0.08)" global_colors_info="{}" theme_builder_area="post_content"]<span>“The object of the Bible is not to tell how good men are, but how bad men can become good.”</span>
<h6><span>-Dwight L.Moody</span></h6>[/et_pb_text][et_pb_text _builder_version="4.18.0" _module_preset="default" text_font="Montserrat|300|||||||" text_font_size="16px" text_line_height="1.6em" header_2_font="Montserrat|500||on|||||" header_2_text_color="#7a7a7a" header_2_font_size="36px" header_3_font="|300||on|||||" header_3_font_size="25px" header_3_line_height="1.5em" background_color="#ffffff" custom_padding="50px|50px|50px|50px|true|true" border_width_top="1px" border_color_top="#ff8200" box_shadow_style="preset3" box_shadow_color="rgba(0,0,0,0.08)" global_colors_info="{}" theme_builder_area="post_content"]<h2>Who Put the Bible together?</h2>
It can sometimes feel like there’s no real right answer to anything. But even amid all the confusion and noise of the world, the Bible can be the one source of information that is completely trustworthy. It teaches us the right way to live, reveals God’s character, and holds the answer to all our big questions.
</span>

<em><strong>2 Timothy 3:16</strong> even describes Scripture as “breathed out by God,” and “profitable for teaching, for reproof, for correction, for training in righteousness” (ESV).</em>[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type="1_4" _builder_version="4.18.0" _module_preset="default" global_colors_info="{}" theme_builder_area="post_content"][et_pb_text _builder_version="4.18.0" _module_preset="default" text_font="Montserrat|300|||||||" text_text_color="#fc842b" text_font_size="16px" text_line_height="1.6em" header_2_font="Montserrat|700||on|||||" header_2_text_color="#7a7a7a" header_2_font_size="23px" header_3_font="|300||on|||||" header_3_font_size="25px" header_3_line_height="1.5em" background_color="#ffffff" width="100%" custom_margin="||||false|false" custom_margin_tablet="|||-25px||" custom_margin_phone="|||0px|false|false" custom_margin_last_edited="on|phone" custom_padding="45px|39px|45px|39px|true|true" border_width_top="1px" border_color_top="#ff8200" box_shadow_style="preset3" box_shadow_color="rgba(0,0,0,0.08)" global_colors_info="{}" theme_builder_area="post_content"]<h2>Table of Contents</h2>
